IMF Mission Chief for SL Masahiro Nozaki in response to a question at the press conference states that the US $ 2.9 billion is sufficient for the recovery of Sri Lanka at this stage.

IMF arrangement is with the people of Sri Lanka, the political environment is important since the economic reforms needs to be carried out & supported by people. There is a political stability prevailing NOW in comparison to the previous IMF visit in June. Peter Breuer, IMF

IMF UPDATE: More than USD2.9 billion:
US $ 2.9 billion is ONLY from IMF, larger funding support is envisaged through other bi-lateral & multi-lateral partners according to IMF experience: IMF Mission Chief for SL Masahiro Nozaki

Financing assurances to restore debt sustainability from Sri Lanka’s official creditors and making a good faith effort to reach a collaborative agreement with private creditors are crucial before the IMF can provide financial support to Sri Lanka. 2/2
IMF Update: Debt relief from Sri Lanka’s creditors and additional financing from multilateral partners will be required to help ensure debt sustainability and close financing gaps.  1/2

Safeguarding financial stability by ensuring a healthy and adequately capitalized banking system, and by upgrading financial sector safety nets and regulatory standards with a revised Banking Act; and
Rebuilding foreign reserves through restoring a market-determined and flexible exchange rate, supported by the comprehensive policy package under the program;

Restoring price stability through data-driven monetary policy action, fiscal consolidation, phasing out monetary financing, and stronger central bank autonomy that allow pursuing a flexible inflation targeting regime. A new Central Bank Act is a cornerstone of this strategy;
Mitigating the impact of the current crisis on the poor and vulnerable by raising social spending, and improving the coverage and targeting of social safety net programs;

Introducing cost-recovery based pricing for fuel and electricity to minimize fiscal risks arising from state-owned enterprises. The team welcomed the authorities’ already announced substantial revenue measures and energy pricing reforms;

These reforms include making personal income tax more progressive and broadening the tax base for corporate income tax and VAT. The program aims to reach a primary surplus of 2.3 percent of GDP by 2024.
